thread.title: 'Kirby is about to turn the program out'
thread.title_full: 'Kirby is about to turn the program out'

title: 'Kirby is about to turn the program out'
text:
Manage 'Kirby is about to turn the program out' Find out what this UGA commit is selling to others and what he has told other schools trying to recruit him. 
ORLANDO, Fl. – The annual Orlando stop of the Nike Football Camps made their stop on Sunday and as you can imagine there was a lot of talent. (Photo: Rusty Mansell, 247Sports) 
One of the best to test so far at any Nike event is 2019 UGA commit Nolan Smith of IMG Academy. 
Smith blew up the testing and scored a 40” vertical in a 6-foot-3, 223 pound frame. 
With that being said Smith said right now he has one main goal and that is recruiting others to join him in Athens. 
“I have been recruiting a lot, lot, lot,” Smith said. 
It is not just one, it is multiple players and especially those he is close to in the 2019 class in Georgia. 
“Keiondre (Jones) Tank, ( Jaylen McCollough ), just a lot of guys I am recruiting to Georgia, a lot of guys,” he said. 
The message is simple to other recruits from Smith. 
“Kirby (Smart) is about to turn the program out and you are really about to see a change,” he said. 
Smith is so committed that rarely does not another school reach out to him anymore. 
“Not really, those schools know I am going to Georgia, that is why I am going there because I am wanted there,” he said. 
Not a member? Try a seven-day FREE trial to VIP access to Dawgs247! 
Recently moving to IMG Academy in Florida, Smith said he is just taking his time and learning from others right now. 
“I am learning a lot from a lot older big timers down there, I am just making sure I am going 100% in all the drills making myself better,”he said. “I am working on everything this spring, there is always room to improve. I learned that from the Pittsburgh Steelers DE, they won a game and he got straight off the plane and went to the weightroom.” 
There is one date right now that Smith says cannot get here fast enough he says. 
“I will be back to Athens for the spring game, I tweeted out that spring game cannot come fast enough for me, I am just waiting and waiting to get up there.” 
Keith Neibuhr conducted this interview for 247Sports on site in Orlando. Author
